summary: The document is a memorandum from S. D. Breckinridge to Mr. Ray Reardon of the Office of Security, dated 22 September 1978, concerning the compilation of files and photographs of Agency employees with the surname Bishop from the 1960s. This effort aims to assist in identifying Morris Bishop, as mentioned by two witnesses. Attached are excerpts from the Office of Personnel Files (OPFs) of several Bishops, providing detailed employment histories, physical descriptions, and other personal information. This memorandum is relevant to historical investigations under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: The memorandum is part of historical investigations under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
It aims to compile photographs of Agency employees named Bishop from the 1960s to help identify Morris Bishop.
Provides detailed personal and employment information for several individuals named Bishop, including service dates, physical descriptions, and positions.
Highlights the Agency's internal procedures for collecting and reviewing historical employee records for investigative purposes.
keywords: President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
